lines.text: We met it seems, such a short time ago. You looked at me, needing me so. Yet from your sadness, our happiness grew. Then I found out, I need you, too. I remember how we used to play. I recall those rainy days, the fires glowed, that kept us warm. And now I find, we're both alone. Goodbye may seem forever, farewell is like the end. But in my heart's a memory, and there you'll always be.
Tod, that Copper is going to come back a hunting dog, a real killer.
Oh no, not my friend Copper. He won't ever change.
I hope you're right.
And we'll keep on being friends forever. Right, Big Mama?
Darling, forever is a long, long time, and time has a way of changing things.
Copper, you're my best friend.
And you're mine too, Tod.
And we'll always be friends forever. Won't we?
Yeah, forever.
Listen good, Tod, 'cause it's either education or elimination.
What are you smelling?
I'm on the trail of something.
Trail of... what?
I don't know yet.
[sniffs Tod]
Why it's... it's you.
[howls]
What'd you do that for?
We're supposed to do that when we find what we've been tracking.
I'm a fox. My name's Tod. What's your name kid?
Mine's Copper. I'm a hound dog.
Oh boy, these old wings ain't what they used to be. Big Mama, you better lose a few pounds.
Darlin, forever is a long, long time, and time has a way of changing things.

[to Tod]
I'll let you go this one time.

[to Tod]
Now, if you're so foxy, and old Chief's so dumb, then why does that hound get the fox on the run? 'Cause he's got the hunter, and the hunter's got the gun. Kablaam! Elimination. Lack of education.
We're still friends, right?
Tod, those days are over. I'm a hunting dog now.

[about Chief]
His ears are almost as big as yours.
That's not the part you gotta worry about.
Gosh, look at those teeth.
That's the part you gotta worry about!
Tod... I don't want to see you get killed.
Oh, Big Mama, I know Copper would never track on me down. Why, Copper, he's my very best friend.
Ho-ho, your best friend! Now Copper's gonna do what he's been told. Supposed to chase the little fox in the old fox hole. And along comes the hunter with a buckshot load.

[pretending to shoot a gun]
K-K-Kabaam!
[Dinky pretends to get shot and falls off the tree]
Elimination.

[lying on the ground]
Lack of education.
You better believe it, Tod, yes siree.
You mean Copper is gonna be my enemy?
Amos Slade, you trigger-happy lunatic! Give me that gun!
[Tweed takes the gun, then shoots Amos' radiator]
My radiator! Why, you blasted female...

[pointing the gun at Amos]
Hold it, right there.
Watch it, that thing's loaded.
[Tweed shoots the gun in the air]
Now it ain't loaded.
Oh, shucks! I think I bent my b-b-b-beak.
I think I did a good job tracking down those varmints for ya.
Trackin' an' smellin' ain't enough. You gotta think nasty.
If you give me a headstart I can beat you.
I bet you'd be good at playing Hide and Seek! Wanna try it, Copper?
Can I use my nose?
Sure. Okay, now go ahead and close your eyes and count.
[Copper turns around and covers his eyes]
One, two, three...
[Copper looks over his shoulder]
No, Copper! You can't peek!
Oh.
Now, try again.
Tod, if it's the last thing I do, I'll get you for this!
[in trying to catch the caterpillar on an electric wire, Dinky and Boomer get zapped]

[wheezes]
Holy...
...smoke!
[coughs]
[Chief has a busted leg and is whimpering loudly]
Chief, get back in there before I break your other leg.
Well, well. Company has come to see the invalid.
[Amos and Copper pass by without paying attention to Chief]
How do you like that? They didn't even ask how I'm feeling.
Amos Slade, that temper of yours is going to get you into a lot of trouble someday.

[turns red in the face]
Temper? Temper? Woman, you ain't seen my temper! If I ever catch that fox in my property again, I'll blast him, and next time I won't miss!
A worm for breakfast? Yuck!
